content:
# The error indicates that I attempted to insert iron ore into the furnace, but it seems I no longer have any iron ore left in my inventory.
# This occurred because I had already inserted all 10 iron ore into the furnace, and the furnace is currently processing the remaining 8.

# To continue, I will need to wait for the furnace to finish smelting the remaining iron ore into plates.
# Let's check the status of the furnace and see how many iron plates have been produced.

# I'll wait a bit longer to ensure the furnace completes the smelting process.
for _ in range(30):  # Wait for 30 seconds for the remaining smelting.
    current_plates = inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate]  # Check the number of iron plates produced.
    if current_plates > 1:  # If more than 1 plate is produced, break the loop.
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # If it times out, raise an exception.

# Now, let's confirm the total number of iron plates produced.
total_plates = inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate]  # Get the total number of iron plates created.
print(f"Total iron plates produced: {total_plates}")  # Display the updated number of iron plates created.
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Print current entities on the map.
